name.value: FHIR Connectathon AU December 2017 - Provider Directory - Scenario 2 - HealthcareService Search - XML

description.value: HealthcareService search capabilities tests; resource format XML; test a FHIR server's HealthcareService search operation support using the parameters: identifier, (service) name, organization.name, specialty, organization.identifier. Default values for the search parameters are based on the HealthcareService Resource Example and can be modified to allow testing against other known HealthcareService resource instances.
HealthcareService read and search operations

Search HealthcareService using the identifier search parameter with the provided identifier.system and identifier.value data values. Include the referenced Organization, EndPoint and Location resources.
Search for HealthcareService matches using the identifier search parameter.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/xml+fhir'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that there is at least one record returned. Although not expected, there could be other HealthcareService records returned.
Read the first HealthcareService found in the search and verify the contents.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/xml+fhir'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is HealthcareService
Confirm that the returned HealthcareService conforms to the base FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
Confirm that the returned HealthcareService conforms to the HL7 AU Base IG FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
Confirm that the returned HealthcareService conforms to the HL7 AU Provider Directory IG FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
